content:
• Wednesday, February 21, 2018
  • SNE

    Videogame sales jump 59% to best January in seven years

    • Holiday holdover? Videogame sales jumped 59% in January to log their highest January total in seven years, with broad increases across categories and hardware flying off the shelves.
    • The total figure rose to $1.096B from a year-ago $690M, according to NPD Group. Hardware sales increased 119% to $278M; software sales were up 51% to $517M; and even accessories jumped 37% to $301M.
    • Hardware sales hit their highest level since January 2011, and the industry moved more than 1M units, with solid performance from PlayStation 4 (NYSE:SNE), Nintendo Switch (OTCPK:NTDOY) and Xbox One (NASDAQ:MSFT) (just a 3% gap from top to bottom there). In accessories, gamecards, gamepads and headsets/headphones all hit January records, analyst Mat Piscatella notes.
    • Monster Hunter: World (OTCPK:CCOEY) topped the software dollar sales chart with the franchise's best debut, followed by Dragon Ball: Fighterz (OTCPK:NCBDF) -- that franchise's best opening since 2002. Call of Duty: WWII (NASDAQ:ATVI), Playerunknown's Battlegrounds (MSFT) and Grand Theft Auto V (NASDAQ:TTWO) all showed continuing strength at spots 3-5.
    • Rounding out the software top 10: No. 6, NBA 2K18 (TTWO); No. 7, Super Mario Odyssey (OTCPK:NTDOY); No. 8, The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild (OTCPK:NTDOY); No. 9, Mario Kart 8 (OTCPK:NTDOY); No. 10, Madden NFL 18 (NASDAQ:EA).
    • After hours: SNE +1%, OTCPK:NTDOY flat, MSFT -0.2%, OTCPK:CCOEY inactive, OTCPK:NCBDF inactive, ATVI -0.4%, TTWO +0.6%, EA +1.9%.
    • ETF: GAMR
    • Previously: Videogames close 2017 with 11% year-over-year sales gain (Jan. 18 2018)
    • Previously: Hardware push lifts December videogame sales 10% from 2016 (Jan. 18 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM | 59 Comments
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners +4% after big Q4 beat; Rover pipeline gets boost

    • Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) +4.2% after-hours as Q4 earnings crush analyst expectations and revenues rise by nearly a third from the year-ago quarter to $8.6B, also easily beating estimates.
    • ETP says adjusted EBITDA for the quarter totaled $1.94B, up 30% Y/Y, reflecting significantly higher results from the midstream and crude oil transportation and services segments; distributable cash flow of $1.2B rose from $960M compared to the same period last year.
    • Distribution coverage ratio of 1.3x; without IDRs, distribution coverage of ~1.1x.
    • Energy Transfer Equity (ETE) +4.6% after-hours despite missing its Q4 earnings and revenue estimates.
    • Separately, the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission today authorized the start-up of the Rover pipeline's Mainline Compressor Station 2 in Ohio, raising total project capacity to ~2B cf/day as the designed 3.25B cf/day project readies for full service later this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 PM | 53 Comments
  • PE

    Parsley Energy gains on easy Q4 earnings beat, rising production

    • Parsley Energy (NYSE:PE) +2.6% after-hours as it easily beats Q4 earnings expectations and doubles revenues from the year-ago quarter to $311M, which also topped analyst estimates.
    • PE says Q4 net production averaged 80.3K boe/day, up 79% Y/Y and up 12% Q/Q, with net oil production rising 69% Y/Y and 9% Q/Q; for the full year, net production averaged 67.9K boe/day.
    • PE forecasts FY 2018 net production of 98K-108K boe/day, and oil production of 65K-70K bbl/day, and plans full-year capex of $1.35B-$1.55B.
    • Year-end 2017 proved reserves of 416M boe rose 87% vs. reserves at the end of 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • CLR

    Continental Resources rises following strong Q4 earnings, production

    • Continental Resources (NYSE:CLR) +1.6% after-hours as it reports better than expected Q4 earnings and revenues, which nearly doubled to $1.05B from the year-ago quarter.
    • CLR says Q4 net production rose 37% Y/Y to ~287K boe/day, with oil output gaining 44% to 168K bbl/day; Bakken net production jumped 58% to an all-time high of 165.6K boe/day, STACK net production surged 96% to 47.9K boe/day, and SCOOP net production fell 2% to 62.2K boe/day.
    • CLR says it brought online 39 gross operated wells in the Bakken during Q4 with a 24-hour initial production average of 2,180 boe/well, and five were record Bakken producers for the company, flowing an average of 2,230 boe/day (80% oil) during first 30 days.
    • CLR estimates Q1 production to come in at 285K-290K boe/day vs. full-year 2017 production of 242.6K boe/day.
    • Year-end 2017 proved reserves of 1.33B boe rose 4% compared with year-end 2016 proved reserves.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 15 Comments

    Okta +2% on preliminary Q4, FY guidance

    • Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) announces preliminary Q4 and FY18 results.
    • Q4: Revenue, $77M to $77.5M (consensus: $70.73M); non-GAAP operating loss of $12.3M to $11.3M; calculated billings, $103.3M to $104.3M (+65% to 66% Y/Y).
    • FY18: Revenue, $259.2M to $259.7M (consensus: ); non-GAAP operating loss, $67.3M to $66.3M; calculated billings, $313.4M to $314.4M (+61% to 62% Y/Y).   
    • Okta also announces plans to offer $300M aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due 2023 in a private offering.
    • Okta shares are up 2% aftermarket.

  • CAR

    Strong outlook sends Avis higher

    • Shares of Avis Budget (NASDAQ:CAR) jump 7.80% in AH trading after the company tops estimates with its Q4 report.
    • The company says it saw positive pricing in the America and it reeled in some costs compared to a year ago.
    • Any anxiety over Avis' guidance was calmed after the company guided for FY18 revenue of $9.20V to $9.45B vs. $9.08 consensus and EPS of $2.90 to $3.05 vs. $3.02 consensus.

  • ROKU

    Roku slides 22% despite Q4 revenue beat

    • Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) is tumbling after hours, down 22% on heavy volume, after its Q4 earnings featured a beat on revenues along with a Q1 sales forecast that came up slightly short of Street expectations.
    • Revenues grew 28% overall, driven by platform growth of 129% (to $85.4M of a total of $188.3M) that made up for a single-digit decline in player revenues.
    • Gross profit rose 64% to $73.5M, and gross margin rose to 39% from a year-ago 30%.
    • EBITDA more than doubled to $14.38M, easily beating expectations for -$2M.
    • Active accounts were up 44% to 19.3M, and streaming hours grew 55% to 4.3B.
    • Average revenue per user, meanwhile, was up 48% to $13.78 on a trailing 12-month basis.
    • Revenue breakout: Player, $02.8M (down 7%); Platform, $85.4M (up 129%).
    • It's guiding to Q1 net revenue of $120M-$130M (light of consensus for $131.7M), net income of -$21M to -$15M and EBITDA of -$16M to -$10M (vs. consensus for -$13.4M).
    • For the full year, it's forecasting net revenue of $660M-$690M (vs. consensus for $661.6M), net income of -$55M to -$40M and EBITDA of -$25M to -$10M (vs. consensus for -$18.3M).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
    • Shareholder letter
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 37 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox Tech +7.9% after Q1 update, CFO transition, new board member

    • Mellanox Tech (NASDAQ:MLNX) updates its Q1 guidance to revenue of $240M to $250M (consensus: $227M).
    • Non-GAAP gross margins expected from 68.5% to 69.5%, operating expenses from $120M to $122M, and share based compensation expenses from $16.3M to $16.8M. 
    • CFO transition: Jacob Shulman accepted an exec position at a pre-IPO company and will step down effective May 4. Company is currently searching for a replacement. 
    • Board member: Mellanox appoints Microchip Technology CEO Steve Sanghi to the board effective immediately. 
    • Mellanox shares are up 7.9% aftermarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 3 Comments

    Ultra Clean Holdings -8.1% after Q4 EPS miss, low EPS guidance

    • Ultra Clean Holdings (NASDAQ:UCTT) shares plunge 8.1% aftermarket following Q4 results that missed EPS estimates but beat revenue estimates by $3M with a 42.6% Y/Y growth.
    • Q1 guidance: Revenue, $275M to $290M (consensus: $261.10M); EPS, $0.56 to $0.63 (consensus: $0.63); non-GAAP operating margin, 8% to 10%; non-GAAP tax rate, 14% to 16%. 
    • Key metrics: Gross margin, 17.7% (+0.7 percentage points Y/Y); cash and equivalents, $68.3M; outstanding debt, $52.3M; operating expenses, $22.11M; cash and equivalents, $68.31M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:45 PM Eastern Time.

  • AAOI

    Applied Opto sinks 15% as revenues shrink, Q1 guidance looks dim

    • Applied Optoelectronics (NASDAQ:AAOI) is 15.3% lower in postmarket trading after its Q4 revenues declined and missed, and Q1 guidance didn't offer much sun.
    • Revenues were "slightly below our expectations due to lower demand from our datacenter customers as they continue to evolve their network architectures," says CEO Thompson Lin, but Lin's still "pleased with our ability to continue to generate strong gross margin even in a price sensitive market."
    • Lin noted the company sees inventory headwinds with one customer and typical Q1 seasonality with the Chinese New Year, but expects a stronger second half.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenue of $67M-$71M (well short of $86.5M consensus), gross margin of 40.5%-41.5%, and EPS of $0.28-$0.34 (vs. consensus for $0.69).
    • In Q4, net income as reported fell to $5.7M from $14.2M. On a non-GAAP basis, it rose to $17.9M from $15.5M.
    • Revenue breakout: Datacenter, $62M (down 9%); CATV, $14.33M (up 6.7%); Telecom, $3.18M (up 11.2%); FTTH, $85,000 (down 64%); Other, $266,000 (down 5.3%).
    • Cash, equivalents, short-term investments and restricted cash was $84M at year-end, vs. the previous year's $52M.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release

  • GWPH

    GW Pharma's GWP42006 flunks mid-stage study in focal seizures

    • GW Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:GWPH) announces that a Phase 2a proof-of-concept study evaluating GWP42006 (cannabidivarin) in adult patients with focal seizures failed to achieve the primary endpoint.
    • The 162-subject trial, conducted primarily in Eastern Europe, failed to demonstrate a treatment effect from GWP42006 over and above placebo. The reduction in focal seizures was ~40% in both arms.
    • On the safety front, 73% of participants in the GWP42006 group experienced a treatment-related adverse event (AE) compared to 48% for placebo. Most AEs were mild or moderate. The incidence of serious AEs was 3.7% in the treatment arm versus 1.2% for placebo.
    • The data analysis is ongoing.
    • Update: Shares are down 6% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 12 Comments

  • P

    Pandora +11.3% as subscriptions add juice to Q4 revenues

    • Pandora Media (NYSE:P) is rebounding heavily after hours, up 11.3%, after its Q4 earnings showed a narrower loss Y/Y and revenue that easily topped Street expectations.
    • Gains in subscription sales more than made up for the loss of ticketing service revenue (which was $19.4M in the prior-year quarter) and a decline in advertising.
    • “From launching on-demand for our ad-supported listeners to expanding multiple device partnerships in the last quarter alone, we’re building a strong foundation for audience growth and improved monetization," says CEO Roger Lynch.
    • Listener hours fell to 5.03B from 5.38B; active listeners at quarter's end were 74.7M.
    • Meanwhile, Pandora Plus and Pandora Premium subscribers came to 5.48M, up 25%.
    • Revenue breakout: Advertising, $297.7M (down 5%); Subscription and other, $97.7M (up 63.2%). Ticketing service revenue was zero vs. a year-ago $19.4M.
    • Cash and investments ended the quarter at $500.8M, roughly flat Y/Y.
    • The company will discuss guidance during its conference call, set for 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 29 Comments

  • HAIR

    Restoration Robotics up 27%

    • Thinly traded relatively recent IPO Restoration Robotics (HAIR +26.8%) is up on almost a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 308K shares. The stock is in the early stages of an up trend after losing almost 70% of its value since its opening day high of $11.95 on October 12, 2017.
    • No particular news accounts for the action. At the end of Q3 2017, the company had ~$5.8M in cash and operations consumed ~$4.8M per quarter through the first three quarters of 2017. The IPO raised ~$25M so its cash runway should extend into at least Q4 of this year.
    • Previously: Restoration Robotics prices IPO at $7, bottom of range (Oct. 11, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • VG

    Vonage -13% after earnings; Citi sees buying opportunity

    • Among those surprised by a 13.1% sell-off in Vonage Holdings (NYSE:VG) today after an in-line earnings report is Citi, which is recommending a Buy.
    • Expectations were too high coming into earnings, analyst Michael Rollins says, and the decline presents an opportunity since he's still high on Vonage's growth potential this year and a balance sheet that allows investment in the business either organically or through M&A. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • It's trading a revenue multiple of 3x, while rivals are more in the 5.6x-8x range, Rollins notes.
    • Craig-Hallum, meanwhile, has boosted its price target to $12, which now implies 20%-plus upside in the shares.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • AZN

    CDC on board with AstraZeneca's Quadrivalent flu vaccine for next year

    • The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) has voted in favor of renewing its recommendation backing the use of AstraZeneca's (AZN +0.9%) FLUMIST QUADRIVALENT (influenza vaccine live, intranasal) in the U.S. for the 2018 - 2019 season.
    • ACIP made its recommendation after viewing positive results from a U.S. study in young children aged 2 to less than 4 years assessing the shedding and antibody responses of the H1N1 strain in the live attenuated flu vaccine.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 6 Comments
  • GE

    GE CFO sees sees full-year earnings at bottom of forecast

    • General Electric (GE -1.4%) is heading toward the low end of its full-year earnings forecast of $1.00-$1.07/share, CFO Jamie Miller said today at the Barclays Industrial Select Conference in Miami.
    • Miller cited the $6.2B charge related to its insurance portfolio and plans to shrink the GE Capital division.
    • Analysts are even less optimistic, having cut FY 2018 EPS expectations to $0.97 according to the average of estimates compiled by Bloomberg.
    • Earlier: GE has no plans to alter Baker Hughes stake before 2019 (Feb. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 71 Comments

    Domino's Pizza +3% amid M&A chatter

    • Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) is up 2.90% on an afternoon spike that may be related to more talk of interest in the company by Restaurant Brands International (QSR -0.5%).
    • Toronto radio station reporter Richard Southern added some fuel to the M&A fire by tweeting within the last hour that his sources indicate that a Restaurant Brands bid is possible. Earlier reports out of Brazil first broke the QSR-DPZ talks.

  • Stocks pare post-FOMC knee-jerk gains as yields jump upward

    • Up more than 1% in the minutes following what's being interpreted as somewhat dovish FOMC minutes, the S&P 500 is now higher by just 0.25% as fixed-income markets reassess.
    • Flat for the day not long ago, the 10-year Treasury yield is up 5.5 basis points to 2.94%, and the two-year yield is higher by 5 basis points to 2.27%. TLT -1.35%, TBT +2.7%
    • Previously: Goldilocks scenario sounds good to the banks (Feb. 21)
    • Previously: Stocks on the move after "dovish" FOMC minutes (Feb. 21)

  • BAC

    Goldilocks scenario sounds good to the banks

    • The broad banking indices ((KRE +2%), (KBE +1.8%)) are up more than double that of the S&P 500 following the release of the minutes from the FOMC's January meeting.
    • Some were expecting the minutes to tip the Fed's interest in hiking four times this year instead of the three rate boosts that's been mostly baked in. Instead, the proceedings showed little concern with overheating, and a continued consensus for a gradual pace of rate hikes.
    • The yield curve has widened since the news (10-year yield flat vs. a decline in 2-year yields), and banks like that.
    • Bank of America (BAC +1.1%), Citigroup (C +2.2%), JPMorgan (JPM +2.1%), Regions Financial (RF +2.3%), PNC Financial (PNC +2.3%), BB&T (BBT +2%), M&T (MTB +2.4%), Zions (ZION +2.5%)
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, VFH, UYG, FNCL, IYF, BTO, IYG, RYF, FXO, SEF, FINU, RWW, FINZ, JHMF, FAZZ, FNCF
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean upbeat about recovery in offshore drilling

    • Transocean (RIG +1.4%) says it is optimistic about a recovery in offshore drilling activity this year, despite reporting its third straight quarterly loss.
    • “Today’s outlook is certainly more encouraging than it was a year ago,” CEO Jeremy Thigpen said in today's earnings conference call, pointing to improvement in utilization and day rates for its harsh-environment rigs and increased tendering activity in the ultra-deepwater area.
    • RIG also was upbeat about activity in Latin America picking up, as countries such as Brazil and Mexico have auctioned offshore blocks to encourage new exploration and drilling activities.
    • Other offshore drillers are higher: ESV +1%, DO +3.5%, RDC +0.5%, NE +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 55 Comments
  • MCS

    Marcus Corporation talks shareholder value

    • Marcus Corporation (MCS +4%) shoots higher after announcing a dividend hike.
    • Management also laid out a shareholder-friendly capital allocation plan. Statements from Marcus Chairman Stephen Marcus related to shareholder value are posted below.
    • “The dividend increase reflects our strong financial performance and ongoing commitment to increasing shareholder value. In addition, we expect a meaningful impact from the tax reform legislation signed into law in December 2017 and are pleased to share this benefit with the key stakeholders who have been instrumental in our growth and success."
    • “The reduction in our effective tax rate will free-up additional cash to invest in our businesses, associates, shareholders and community. In addition to the significantly higher quarterly dividend payment."
    • "We expect to identify additional opportunities to utilize the additional cash to benefit all of our stakeholders in 2018."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 1 Comment

  • Stocks on the move after "dovish" FOMC minutes

    • Many in the market had been bracing for a signal that a fourth rate hike was on the table for 2018, but those bets are being pulled after the January FOMC minutes showed minimal worry about speedier wage pressures.
    • Some on the committee also believe the net effect of tax cuts could be temporarily slower inflation as corporations look to gain market share by cutting prices.
    • The Dow (NYSEARCA:DIA), S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY), and Nasdaq (NASDAQ:QQQ) have all jumped to 1%-plus gains.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield remains at about 2.90%, but the two-year yield - up three basis points ahead of the minutes - has returned to about flat on the session.
    • The dollar (UUP, UDN) has turned only modestly lower, and gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) has added a couple of dollars, now up 0.4% today.
    • Previously: FOMC minutes: Gradual hike policy still in place (Feb. 21)
    • ETFs: IEF, PST, IEI, VGIT, UST, DTYS, TYO, GSY, SCHR, TBX, TYD, ITE, DTYL, TFLO, USFR, HYDD, DFVL, TYNS, DFVS
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 31 Comments
  • NVO

    Express Scripts on board with Novo's Ozempic; shares ahead 2%

    • Novo Nordisk (NVO +2%) is up more than a 40% spike in volume on the heels of the news that Express Scripts has added once-weekly type 2 diabetes med Ozempic (semaglutide) to its 2018 formulary, thereby establishing head-to-head competition with Eli Lilly's once-weekly Trulicity (dulaglutide), a situation enthusiastically embraced by the price hawkish pharmacy benefit manager.
    • According to Reuters, a Novo spokesperson stated that inclusion in Express Scripts' formulary should give Ozempic access to a "single-digit share" of the overall GLP-1 market in the U.S.
    • Both products will also compete against AstraZeneca's once-weekly BYDUREON (exenatide).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 5 Comments

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (2/21/2018)

    • Losers: OTC:ANW -41%. SLCA -16%. KRA -14%. SND -11%. DVN -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM

  • COLL

    Collegium dinged by FDA over misbranding Xtampza ER at trade show; shares down 3%

    • Collegium Pharmaceutical (COLL -2.7%) discloses that it has received a letter from the FDA over misbranding pain med Xtampza ER (oxycodone) at a trade show in Minneapolis, MN last June.
    • Specifically, the agency said the company failed to adequately convey the risks of the drug in its exhibit booth at the American Society Health-System Pharmacists Summer Meetings & Exhibition 2017. Apparently, the signage in the booth touted the benefits of Xtampza ER but no information on its limitations of use and risks of addiction and abuse. The company did have a side panel about the risks and limitations of use, but it was located away from the principal display without sufficient visual cues linking it to the main panel.
    • The company has until February 24 to submit a letter to the FDA confirming that it will comply with the agency's request to address the misbranding.
    • The FDA OK'd the abuse-deterrent opioid in November 2017 with a boxed warning about the risks and abuse potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 4 Comments

  • EYEN

    FDA to require only one late-stage study to support marketing application for Eyenovia's MicroPine for myopia; shares up 2%

    • Eyenovia (EYEN +1.7%) announces that the FDA has indicated that only one pivotal Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating MicroPine for the treatment of myopia (nearsightedness) will be required to support a U.S. marketing application. The agency has also provided clarity on the design of the study, expected to launch about mid-2019.
    • MicroPine is a micro-therapeutic formulation of atropine, an anticholinergic agent (inhibits acetylcholine) used historically to treat certain types of poisoning, life-threatening low heart rate, stomach/intestinal spasms and to reduce mucus and other body secretions.
